newsitem.title: USA: API says U.S. crude stocks rose in week.
newsitem.headline: API says U.S. crude stocks rose in week.

text.p: U.S. crude oil stocks held in primary storage rose 4.70 million barrels in the week ended July 4 to 322.66 million barrels from 317.96 million barrels the previous week, the American Petroleum Institute said Tuesday.
API said that crude stocks excluding PADD 5 (Petroleum Administration for Defense District) rose 5.30 million barrels in the week to 259.79 million barrels.
Distillate stocks rose 11,000 barrels to 115.93 million barrels from a revised 115.92 million barrels the prior week. API previously reported distillate stocks at 116.65.
API said PADD 1 distillate stocks rose 792,000 barrels to 41.27 million barrels.
It said gasoline production fell 126,000 barrels per day in the week to 7.97 million bpd from 8.10 million bpd in the prior week.
Gasoline stocks fell 137,000 barrels in the week to 204.10 million barrels from 204.23 million.
Percent of stocks capacity fell to 95.6 percent from 96.9 percent the prior week.
API said reformulated gasoline stocks (RFG) rose 243,000 barrels to 43.15 million barrels from 42.91 million barrels the previous week.
API also said refinery operating rate excluding PADD 5 rose to 99.8 percent in the week from 97.8 percent the previous week.
API said crude runs to processing units fell to 14.76 million barrels per day from 14.99 million the previous week.
Residual fuel stocks in the latest week fell to 40.41 million barrels from 41.20 million in the previous week.
Crude oil imports rose to 8.96 million barrels per day from 8.06 million, API said.
